hackathon-description-text: The 2017 GBIF Ebbe Nielsen Challenge will award a total of €14,000 to developers and data scientists who create tools capable of liberating species records from open data repositories for scientific discovery and reuse.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Professor of Taxonomy, University of Glasgow | Chair, GBIF Science Committee
Professor in Biodiversity & Systematics, University of Gothenburg
Information Systems Manager, SANBI: South African National Biodiversity Institute
Co-coordinator LACOS21 | Lecturer, Federal University of Alagoas, Brazil
Node Manager, GBIF Argentina | Museo Argentino de Ciencias Naturales (CONICET) and Sistema Nacional de Datos Biológicos (SNDB-MinCyT)
Associate Professor of Biology, George Washington University

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the Submission reusable and interoperable across different public data repositories and aggregator systems? Based on these choices, approximately how many datasets might the Submission be expected to liberate?
How well does the Submission work? Does it have a working prototype? Does it respect and maintain existing licences?

hackathon-description-header: Liberating species records from open data repositories for scientific discovery and reuse
